law.catch_line: The sanitary commission of a district with 2 member counties consists of at least:...

section.section:
The sanitary commission of a district with 2 member counties consists of at least:
One sanitary commissioner from each member county appointed as the articles of incorporation of the district provide; and
One sanitary commissioner from either member county as the articles of incorporation of the district provide.
The sanitary commission of a multiple county district with at least 3 member counties consists of a number of sanitary commissioners equal to at least the number of member counties.

The sanitary commission of a district that adds an incoming member county consists of:
The sanitary commissioners in office before the admission of the incoming county; and
At least one sanitary commissioner from the incoming county.

text.section: A sanitary commissioner of a multiple county district shall be a resident of the member county from which the sanitary commissioner is appointed.
If a member county withdraws from a district, the term of each sanitary commissioner who was appointed from that county ends when the withdrawal is effective.

section.section:
Except for the term of the first sanitary commissioner who represents each incoming county admitted to a district, the term of a sanitary commissioner in a multiple county district is the lesser of:
6 years; or
The term provided in the articles of incorporation of the district.
The term of the first sanitary commissioner from an incoming county admitted to a district is 6 years.
The terms of sanitary commissioners in a multiple county district are staggered as required by the articles of incorporation of the district.
At the end of a term, a sanitary commissioner in a multiple county district continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A sanitary commissioner in a multiple county district who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and as required by the articles of incorporation of the district.
